comment.author: 66151649@N02
comment._content: I see bamboo (actually I just read the tag on the right ;)

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/66151649@N02] Ooops, the independent adjudicator from KPMG will allow bamboo. I tagged for it because I blindly mistook a thin roof strut as a (dead) bamboo support for the banana palm...
But where's the live bamboo?
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content:
We've got string beans and onions,
Cabashes and scallions,
all kinds of fruit and say, 
we've got an old fashioned potato,
a new fashioned tomato,
and Yes, we have no bananas
NLI you stole (sorry "REPURPOSED" [whatever that means]) a line from my late aunts party piece which she belted out each time she had a few sherries on her!  It really got the family going and caused great amusement!  I cannot see any obvious bamboo but the fine leaves high behind the banana may just be what you describe!

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] "Stole" is such an ugly word! I "repurposed" it...  :)
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: Phormium from Seuss looks plausible, but not so convinced by his suggestion of Aspidistra... And [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] don't think that they look like bamboo leaves when you check against the huge size:
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Have reduced the note box to show the leaves I meant to question.  Bamboo is a grass of course and like most grasses the leaves are long and pointed, very young ones are long and very fine as these seem to be.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/swordscookie] Still not sure about the bamboo, but bear in mind, botany isn't at all my area of expertise...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 23885771@N03
comment._content: Bananas like that still grow in the Palm House of the Botanic Gardens.
